page.title: 17UPPER HARTFIELD WOODS
page.content: The Paternoster Wood in Upper Hartfield was originally scrub land and was sold with the possibility of it becoming an agricultural holding. The owner hoped to obtain permission for a caravan on the site and eventually a house. In clearing the land,trees were felled illegally, locals became angry as the countryside changed without planning permission. The owner started tipping on the land which caused more friction. The Sussex County Council and the Wealdon Council were inefficient in dealing with the legality of this problem. Neighbours and local planners became upset when shelter belt trees were felled (30 feet deep woodland along roadside). It transpires that the land is being sold again and assurances that felling & tipping will stop and replantation occur have been given.
